trending.title: NFL minicamp 2025 live updates: Saquon Barkley refreshed, ready to run it back
trending.description:
The majority of NFL mandatory minicamps are in action this week. Our reporters have the latest from around the league.

Related Context:
Will Philly's coordinator swap impact Jalen Hurts? Are Patrick Mahomes and Jayden Daniels headed for big years? Could Lamar Jackson get another big payday?

trending.title: 'Hard work does pay off': At 17, Mason Howell is the youngest player in the U.S. Open field
trending.description:
Howell is a high school junior from Georgia who shot 63-63 in qualifying to get into the field. How did he get here, and what is he hoping for from the biggest week of his golfing career.

Related Context:

trending.title: üèÄ NBA mock draft: Debating 30 Round 1 picks
trending.description: Best player available? Fill a need? We played out both strategies for 30 first-round slots in the draft. (Original content)

trending.title: Sources: Mavs join in denying Knicks' requests
trending.description:
The Knicks have now been denied permission to speak with Dallas Mavericks coach Jason Kidd, Timberwolves coach Chris Finch and Rockets coach Ime Udoka, sources confirmed to ESPN.

Related Context:
San Diego Wave winger and Mexico international Maria Sanchez is currently in "very advanced" negotiations with Liga MX Femenil's Tigres, sources have told ESPN.

trending.title: Deion eager to rejoin Buffs after missed camps
trending.description:
Deion Sanders posted on social media Wednesday that "everything is OKAY" after the Buffaloes coach has not attended football camps in Boulder, Colorado.

Related Context:

updates.title: Tiger: U.S. Open 'favors' long hitters, short irons
updates.description:
Three-time U.S. Open champion Tiger Woods says this week's major at Oakmont "favors long hitters" and the ability to control "shorter iron" shots.

Related Context:

updates.title: WTA to protect rankings after fertility procedures
updates.description:
Women's tennis players who choose to undergo a fertility protection procedure will be allowed to take time away from the sport and return to competitive action with a protected ranking, the WTA announced Wednesday.

Related Context:

updates.title: Switzerland routs U.S. in Gold Cup sendoff loss
updates.description:
The United States gave up four goals in the first half and looked unprepared for next year's World Cup, getting routed by Switzerland 4-0 in a friendly on Tuesday in Nashville, losing its fourth straight game for the first time since 2007.

Related Context:

updates.title: Hard tag reignites Chisholm's feud with Garcia
updates.description:
The bad blood between the Yankees' Jazz Chisholm and the Royals' Maikel Garcia resurfaced Tuesday night when Chisholm left with a sore neck after an attempted tag from Garcia.

Related Context:
Howell is a high school junior from Georgia who shot 63-63 in qualifying to get into the field. How did he get here, and what is he hoping for from the biggest week of his golfing career.

updates.title: WADA urges U.S. to shut down Enhanced Games
updates.description:
The global watchdog of doping in sports said Wednesday it will urge public authorities to shut down the drug-fueled Enhanced Games planned in Las Vegas next year.

Related Context:

updates.title: WR Adams: Joining Rams 'exactly what I needed'
updates.description:
Davante Adams has only been in Los Angeles for one offseason, but the new Rams wide receiver said he feels "rejuvenated" compared to his last few NFL seasons.

Related Context:

updates.title: Whose NHL draft stock rose, declined at the scouting combine?
updates.description: The annual event took place this past week in Buffalo -- with major repercussions for the draft on June 27-28. (Original content)

updates.title: Alexis asks for forgiveness as Chile miss '26 WC
updates.description:
Chile will miss their third straight World Cup after losing 2-0 at Bol√≠via on Tuesday to remain last in South America's 10-team round-robin competition.

Related Context:

updates.title: Van de Ven: 'Strange' choice to sack Postecoglou
updates.description: Tottenham Hotspur defender Micky van de Ven has described the decision to sack manager Ange Postecoglou as "strange." (Original content)

updates.title: Man City bolster midfield with Reijnders signing
updates.description:
Manchester City have bolstered Pep Guardiola's midfield options with the signing of Tijjani Reijnders from AC Milan.

Related Context:
Manchester United winger Alejandro Garnacho is attracting interest from Aston Villa. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

updates.title: Ancelotti's first Brazil win seals World Cup spot
updates.description: Brazil qualified for the 2026 World Cup with a 1-0 win over Paraguay on Tuesday night in Sao Paulo. (Original content)

updates.title: Tuchel: England 'frozen' in historic loss to Senegal
updates.description:
Thomas Tuchel admitted England were "frozen" in their 3-1 friendly defeat to Senegal but insisted there was no cause for panic ahead of next year's World Cup.

Related Context:

updates.title: Hayes giving overworked U.S. stars summer break
updates.description:
United States coach Emma Hayes told ESPN she will call up a roster composed almost exclusively of domestic players for the team's training camp later this month to allow European-based players to rest after a long club season.

Related Context:

updates.title: Mexico changes LA hotels over safety concerns
updates.description:
Mexico will change hotels in Los Angeles ahead of their Gold Cup match because of safety concerns amid the protests against immigration raids, a source told ESPN.

Related Context:

updates.title: Five biggest outliers of the NBA Finals
updates.description: Among steals, scoring and other stats, which ones stand out and which might swing the rest of the Finals? (Original content)
